x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Many professionals and learners want to acquire new skills, but formal courses can be expensive or time-consuming. Often, someone with real time expertise in one area wants to learn another skill, while another person wants the reverse. Currently, there’s no structured platform for pairing learners with complementary skills to teach each other efficiently. Without guidance, it’s hard to find the right partner, track progress, and maintain accountability. for example, I want to learn Salesforce and Someone wants to learn ServiceNow, we can use this and share our knowledge and skills with each other
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: SkillBuddy: A ServiceNow App for Mutual Learning and Mentorship
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow App Engine – Core skill pairing, session scheduling, and workflow management.
UI Builder / Service Portal – User-friendly dashboard for learning, teaching, and tracking.
Flow Designer – Automate reminders, notifications, and milestone tracking.
IntegrationHub – Optional video call, chat, or resource-sharing integration.
Reporting & Analytics – Track skill exchanges, user engagement, and learning outcomes.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

None all using, we can develop everything using out of the box capabilities 

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

None; Language barriers may exist but we will encourage users to use their mother tongue or language comfortable to them
